Detailed Description

The Caller ID for FSK Interface.

FSK

Frequency-shift keying (FSK) is mainly used for caller ID applications.
There are several types of FSK There are listed as following:

  • 1. ETSI FSK (formed by the European Telecommunications -1 and -2)
    • For ETSI Caller-ID support in France, Germany, Norway, Italy, Spain, South Africa, Turkey, and UK (CCA)
    • Standards: ETS 300 788-1 (Type I), ETS 300 788-2 (Type II)
  • 2. Bellcore FSK (formed by the Telcordia Technologies)
    • For Telcordia Caller-ID support in North America Australia, China, Hong Kong, and Singapore
    • Standards: Telcordia GR-30-CORE
  • 3. BT FSK (formed by the British Telecom)
    • For ETSI Caller-ID support in UK (British Telecom)
    • Standards: British Telecomm SIN227, SIN242
  • 4. NTT FSK
    • For NTT FSK Caller-ID support in Japan
    • Standards: Nippon Telegraph & Telephone Corporation standard

Standards/Recommendations

  • ETSI FSK
  • Bellcore FSK
  • BT FSK
  • NTT FSK

VMWI

Voice Message Waiting Indicator (VMWI) is the feature of the illuminate of LED on select telephone to notify the voice mail messages.

Function Documentation

int32 rtk_GenFskCid ( uint32  chid,
char *  str_cid,
char *  str_date,
char *  str_cid_name,
char  mode 
)

FSK Caller ID Generation.

Parameters
chidThe FXS channel number.
str_cidThe Caller ID
str_dateThe Caller Date
str_cid_nameThe Caller ID Name
modeMode
0: type I
1: type II
Note
When application calls this API to send FSK caller ID, DSP ring the phone automatically after sending caller ID.
So, there is no need to ring the phone by application.
If caller ID is configured to sendbetween 1st and 2nd ring, DSP also can handle it with ring cadence automatically.
Return values
0Success
-2Busy state
Examples:
caller_id.c, and fskgen.c.
int32 rtk_GenMdmfFskCid ( uint32  chid,
TstFskClid *  pClid,
uint32  num_clid_element 
)

FSK Caller ID Generation.

This API provides to generate Multiple Data Message Format (MDMF) which is Name+number caller ID.

Parameters
chidThe FXS channel number.
pClidThe pointer of FSK Caller ID Data
num_clid_elementThe number of FSK Caller ID element
Note
When application calls this API to send FSK caller ID, DSP ring the phone automatically after sending caller ID.
So, there is no need to ring the phone by application.
If caller ID is configured to send between 1st and 2nd ring, DSP also can handle it with ring cadence automatically.
Return values
0Success
-2Busy state
Examples:
fskgen.c.
int32 rtk_SetFskArea ( uint32  chid,
uint32  area 
)

Set the FSK Area.

Parameters
chidThe FXS channel number.
areaThe area of FSK.
Bit 0-2: Area
- 0: Bellcore
- 1: ETSI
- 2: BT
- 3: NTT
Bit 3: Caller ID Prior First Ring
- 0: Between 1st ring and 2nd ring
- 1: Send Caller ID before 1st ring
Bit 4: Dual Tone before Caller ID (Fsk Alert Tone)
- 0: False
- 1: True
Bit 5: Short Ring before Caller ID
- 0: False
- 1: True
Bit 6: Reverse Polarity before Caller ID (Line Reverse)
- 0: Forward
- 1: Reverse
Bit 7: FSK Date & Time Sync and Display Name
- 0: False
- 1: True
Bit 8: Auto SLIC Action
- 0: Disable
- 1: Enable
SLIC action, such as SLIC Ringing, SLIC hook statue check, line polarity change
Return values
0Success
Examples:
caller_id.c, fskgen.c, fxo.c, and vmwigen.c.

paraThe variable pointer of FSK Caller ID Parameters

int32 rtk_GetFskCidState ( uint32  chid,
uint32 *  cid_state 
)

Get the FSK caller ID send completed or not.

Parameters
chidThe FXS channel number.
cid_stateCID state
0: FSK CID transmission is completed.
1: Sending FSK CID.
Return values
0Success
